parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any parliamentary candidate or party.  It promotes the work of Romsilva, a Romanian state-owned forestry company.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and aims to reach a wide audience, not just specific individuals. The use of hashtags further suggests a broad reach.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The objective of the post is to showcase the beauty of Romanian forests managed by Romsilva and promote the organization's work. There is no discernible attempt to influence voters in any election.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post could be considered a form of public relations or corporate social responsibility communication, similar to a journalistic approach in its presentation of information about Romsilva's activities. It aims to inform the public about the organization's role in managing Romania's forests.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>Not applicable. The post does not express personal opinions.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>591520273438555</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post by Regia Nationala a Padurilor - Romsilva is a paid advertisement showcasing the beauty of Romanian forests.  While the post is categorized as "POLITICAL" due to Facebook's automated system, a closer examination reveals no connection to the parliamentary elections or any specific candidate. The content focuses solely on promoting Romsilva's work in forestry management.  The post does not advocate for or against any candidate, nor does it attempt to influence voting behavior.  The hashtags used are related to nature and environmental themes, not political campaigns. The spend is below RON 100, which is a small amount for a Facebook ad. The target audience is broad, encompassing various age groups and locations across Romania.  Therefore, it does not meet the criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006 and Article 98 t) of LEGE nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>Regia Nationala a Padurilor - Romsilva</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
